accountId.name: accountId
accountId.description: Internal identifier of a RingCentral account or tilde (~) to indicate the account logged-in within the current session

answeringRuleId.name: answeringRuleId
answeringRuleId.description: Internal identifier of an answering rule. The value can be standard digital ID or specific ID - either business-hours-rule or after-hours-rule

attachmentId.name: attachmentId
attachmentId.description: Internal identifier of a message attachment

blockedNumberId.name: blockedNumberId
blockedNumberId.description: Internal identifier of a blocked number list entry

callLogId.name: callLogId
callLogId.description: Internal identifier of a call log record

companyPagerId.name: companyPagerId
companyPagerId.description: Internal identifier of a pager message

contactId.name: contactId
contactId.description: Internal identifier of a contact record in the RingCentral database

customDataKey.name: customDataKey
customDataKey.description: Custom data access key. The number of unique custom data keys is limited to 100 keys per extension, summarized for all the applications. For example, if you have created 50 custom data keys under the Android mobile client application for the particular extension, then logged in the iOS application and created another 50 keys, the web client application won't be allowed to create any custom data key for that extension

departmentId.name: departmentId
departmentId.description: Internal identifier of a Department extension (same as extensionId but only the ID of a department extension is valid)

extensionId.name: extensionId
extensionId.description: Internal identifier of an extension or tilde (~) to indicate the extension assigned to the account logged-in within the current session

faxId.name: faxId
faxId.description: Internal identifier of a fax message

groupId.name: groupId
groupId.description: Internal identifier of a group in an address book

phoneNumberId.name: phoneNumberId
phoneNumberId.description: Internal identifier of a phone number

recordingId.name: recordingId
recordingId.description: Internal identifier of recording (returned in Call Log)

ringoutId.name: ringoutId
ringoutId.description: Internal identifier of a RingOut call

scaleSize.name: scaleSize
scaleSize.description: Dimensions of a profile image which will be returned in response.

secretQuestionId.name: secretQuestionId
secretQuestionId.description: Internal identifier of a secret question

servicePlanId.name: servicePlanId
servicePlanId.description: Internal identifier of a service plan

smsId.name: smsId
smsId.description: Internal identifier of an SMS message

userGroupId.name: userGroupId
userGroupId.description: Internal identifier of an user group

verificationCallId.name: verificationCallId
verificationCallId.description: Internal identifier of a verification call

id.description: Internal identifier of an account

mainNumber.description: Main phone number of the current account

operator.description: Operator's extension information. This extension will receive all calls and messages intended for the operator

partnerId.description: Additional account identifier, developed and applied by the client

serviceInfo.description: Account service information, including brand, service plan and billing plan

setupWizardState.description: Specifies account configuration wizard state (web service setup). The default value is 'NotStarted'

statusInfo.description: Status information (reason, comment, lifetime). Returned for 'Disabled' status only

freeSoftPhoneLinesPerExtension.description: The maximum number of free softphone digital lines per user extension

meetingSize.description: The maximum number of participants in RingCentral Meeting hosted by this account's user

maxMonitoredExtensionsPerUser.description: The maximum number of extensions which can be included in the list of users monitored for Presence

id.description: Addon identifier. For HardPhones of certain types, which are compatible with this addon identifier

count.description: Number of addons. For HardPhones of certain types, which are compatible with such addon identifier

uri.description: Canonical URI to the answering rule resource

id.description: Internal identifier of an asnwering rule

name.description: Name of an answering rule specified by user

enabled.description: Specifies if an answering rule is active or inactive

schedule.description: Schedule when an answering rule should be applied

calledNumbers.description: Answering rules are applied when calling to selected number(s)

callers.description: Answering rules are applied when calls are received from specified caller(s)

callHandlingAction.description: Specifies how incoming calls are forwarded

forwarding.description: Forwarding parameters. Returned if 'ForwardCalls' is specified in 'callHandlingAction'. These settings determine the forwarding numbers to which the call will be forwarded

unconditionalForwarding.description: Unconditional forwarding parameters. Returned if 'UnconditionalForwarding' is specified in 'callHandlingAction'

voicemail.description: Specifies whether to take a voicemail and who should do it

contentType.description: Type of custom data attachment, see also MIME Types

id.description: Internal identifier of a billing plan
Standard resource properties ID and canonical URI, see the section called “Resource Identification Properties”

uri.description: Canonical URI of a blocked number resource

name.description: Name assigned by a user to a blocked phone number

id.description: Internal identifier of a brand
Internal identifier of a cal log record

uri.description: Canonical URI of a call log record

sessionId.description: Internal identifier of a call session

action.description: Action description of the call operation

result.description: Status description of the call operation

startTime.description: The call start datetime in ISO 8601 format including timezone, for example 2016-03-10T18:07:52.534Z

recording.description: Call recording data. Returned if the call is recorded

id.description: Internal identifier of a cal log record

uri.description: Canonical URI of a call log record

sessionId.description: Internal identifier of a call session

action.description: Action description of the call operation

result.description: Status description of the call operation

startTime.description: The call start datetime in ISO 8601 format including timezone, for example 2016-03-10T18:07:52.534Z

recording.description: Call recording data. Returned if the call is recorded, the withRecording parameter is set to 'True' in this case

lastModifiedTime.description: For 'Detailed' view only. The datetime when the call log record was modified in ISO 8601 format including timezone, for example 2016-03-10T18:07:52.534Z

phoneNumber.description: Phone number of a party. Usually it is a plain number including country and area code like 18661234567. But sometimes it could be returned from database with some formatting applied, for example (866)123-4567. This property is filled in all cases where parties communicate by means of global phone numbers, for example when calling to direct numbers or sending/receiving SMS

extensionNumber.description: Extension short number (usually 3 or 4 digits). This property is filled when parties communicate by means of short internal numbers, for example when calling to other extension or sending/receiving Company Pager message

location.description: Contains party location (city, state) if one can be determined from phoneNumber. This property is filled only when phoneNumber is not empty and server can calculate location information from it (for example, this information is unavailable for US toll-free numbers)

name.description: Symbolic name associated with a party. If the phone does not belong to the known extension, only the location is returned, the name is not determined then

phoneNumber.description: Dial-in phone number to connect to a conference

default.description: 'True' if the number is default for the conference. Default conference number is a domestic number that can be set by user (otherwise it is set by the system). Only one default number per country is allowed

allowJoinBeforeHost.description: Determines if host user allows conference participants to join before the host

hostCode.description: Access code for a host user

phoneNumber.description: Primary conference phone number for user's home country returned in E.164 (11-digits) format

tapToJoinUri.description: Short URL leading to the service web page Tap to Join for audio conference bridge

phoneNumbers.description: List of multiple dial-in phone numbers to connect to audio conference service, relevant for user's brand. Each number is given with the country and location information, in order to let the user choose the less expensive way to connect to a conference. The first number in the list is the primary conference number, that is default and domestic

country.description: Information on a home country of a conference phone number

default.description: 'True' if the number is default for the conference. Default conference number is a domestic number that can be set by user (otherwise it is set by the system). Only one default number per country is allowed

hasGreeting.description: 'True' if the greeting message is played on this number

location.description: Location (city, region, state) of a conference phone number

phoneNumber.description: Dial-in phone number to connect to a conference

id.description: Internal identifier of a country

callingCode.description: Country calling code defined by ITU-T recommendations E.123 and E.164, see Calling Codes

emergencyCalling.description: Emergency calling feature availability/emergency address requirement indicator

isoCode.description: Country code according to the ISO standard, see ISO 3166

country.description: Country name of extension user company. Not returned for Address Book

state.description: State/province name of extension user company

city.description: City name of extension user company

street.description: Street address of extension user company

zip.description: Zip code of extension user company

firstName.description: For User extension type only. Extension user first name

lastName.description: For User extension type only. Extension user last name

businessAddress.description: Business address of extension user company

id.description: Internal identifier of a home country

uri.description: Canonical URI of a home country

name.description: Official name of a home country

transportType.description: Notifications transportation provider name. 'APNS' (Apple Push Notifications Service)

encryption.description: Optional parameter. Specifies if the message will be encrypted or not. For APNS transport type the value is always "false"

address.description: PubNub channel name. For APNS transport type - internal identifier of a device "device_token"

subscriberKey.description: PubNub subscriber credentials required to subscribe to the channel

secretKey.description: PubNub subscriber credentials required to subscribe to the channel. Optional (for PubNub transport type only)

encryptionAlgorithm.description: Encryption algorithm 'AES' (for PubNub transport type only)

encryptionKey.description: Key for notification message decryption (for PubNub transport type only)

id.description: Internal identifier of an extension

partnerId.description: For Partner Applications Internal identifier of an extension created by partner. The RingCentral supports the mapping of accounts and stores the corresponding account ID/extension ID for each partner ID of a client application. In request URIs partner IDs are accepted instead of regular RingCentral native IDs as path parameters using pid = XXX clause. Though in response URIs contain the corresponding account IDs and extension IDs. In all request and response bodies these values are reflected via partnerId attributes of account and extension

id.description: Internal identifier of a department extension

uri.description: Canonical URI of a department extension

id.description: Internal identifier of a device

sku.description: Device identification number (stock keeping unit) in the format TP-ID [-AT-AC], where TP is device type (HP for RC HardPhone, DV for all other devices including softphone); ID - device model ID; AT -addon type ID; AC - addon count (if any). For example 'HP-56-2-2'

type.description: Device type. The default value is 'HardPhone'

name.description: Device name. Mandatory if ordering "SoftPhone" or "OtherPhone". Optional for "HardPhone". If not specified for HardPhone, then device "model" name is used as device "name"

serial.description: Serial number for HardPhone (is returned only when the phone is shipped and provisioned); endpoint_id for softphone and mobile applications

extension.description: This attribute can be omitted for unassigned devices

emergencyServiceAddress.description: Address for emergency cases. The same emergency address is assigned to all the numbers of one device

shipping.description: Shipping information, according to which devices (in case of "HardPhone") or e911 stickers (in case of "SoftPhone" and "OtherPhone") will be delivered to the customer

boxBillingId.description: Box billing identifier of a device. Applicable only for HardPhones. It is an alternative way to identify the device to be ordered. Either "model" structure, or "boxBillingId" must be specified for HardPhone

id.description: Internal identifier of an extension

partnerId.description: For Partner Applications Internal identifier of an extension created by partner. The RingCentral supports the mapping of accounts and stores the corresponding account ID/extension ID for each partner ID of a client application. In request URIs partner IDs are accepted instead of regular RingCentral native IDs as path parameters using pid = XXX clause. Though in response URIs contain the corresponding account IDs and extension IDs. In all request and response bodies these values are reflected via partnerId attributes of account and extension

phoneNumber.description: Phone number of the dial-in number for the meeting in e.164 format

formattedNumber.description: Phone number of the dial-in number formatted according to the extension home country

location.description: Optional field in case the dial-in number is associated with a particular location

country.description: Country resource corresponding to the dial-in number

id.description: Internal identifier of a country

callingCode.description: Country calling code defined by ITU-T recommendations E.123 and E.164, see Calling Codes

isoCode.description: Country code according to the ISO standard, see ISO 3166

id.description: Internal identifier of a country

callingCode.description: Country calling code defined by ITU-T recommendations E.123 and E.164, see Calling Codes

isoCode.description: Country code according to the ISO standard, see ISO 3166

street.description: Street address, line 1 - street address, P.O. box, company name, c/o

street2.description: Street address, line 2 - apartment, suite, unit, building, floor, etc.

id.description: Internal identifier of an extension

departments.description: Information on department extension(s), to which the requested extension belongs. Returned only for user extensions, members of department, requested by single extensionId

partnerId.description: For Partner Applications Internal identifier of an extension created by partner. The RingCentral supports the mapping of accounts and stores the corresponding account ID/extension ID for each partner ID of a client application. In request URIs partner IDs are accepted instead of regular RingCentral native IDs as path parameters using pid = XXX clause. Though in response URIs contain the corresponding account IDs and extension IDs. In all request and response bodies these values are reflected via partnerId attributes of account and extension

permissions.description: Extension permissions, corresponding to the Service Web permissions 'Admin' and 'InternationalCalling'

references.description: List of non-RC internal identifiers assigned to an extension

regionalSettings.description: Extension region data (timezone, home country, language)

serviceFeatures.description: Extension service features returned in response only when the logged-in user requests his/her own extension info, see also Extension Service Features

setupWizardState.description: Specifies extension configuration wizard state (web service setup). The default value is 'NotStarted'

status.description: Extension current state. If the status is 'Unassigned'. Returned for all extensions

statusInfo.description: Status information (reason, comment). Returned for 'Disabled' status only

setupWizardState.description: Specifies extension configuration wizard state (web service setup). The default value is 'NotStarted'

greetingLanguage.description: Information on language used for telephony greetings

formattingLocale.description: Formatting language preferences for numbers, dates and currencies

id.description: Internal identifier of a formatting language
Internal identifier of a greeting language
Language identifier. The default value is "1033" (English US)
Timezone identifier. The default value is "58" (US&Canada)

statusInfo.description: Extension status information, only for the 'Disabled' status

enabled.description: Feature status; shows feature availability for an extension

featureName.description: Feature name, see all available values in Service Feature List

reason.description: Reason of limitation for a particular service feature. Returned only if the enabled parameter value is 'False', see Service Feature Limitations and Reasons. When retrieving service features for an extension, the reasons for the limitations, if any, are returned in response

accountId.description: User type of a meeting account

id.description: Internal identifier of a formatting language

localeCode.description: Localization code of a formatting language

name.description: Official name of a formatting language

notifyMySoftPhones.description: Specifies if the user's softphone(s) are notified before forwarding the incoming call to desk phones and forwarding numbers

notifyAdminSoftPhones.description: Specifies if the administrator's softphone is notified before forwarding the incoming call to desk phones and forwarding numbers. The default value is 'False'

softPhonesRingCount.description: Number of rings before forwarding starts

ringingMode.description: Specifies the order in which forwarding numbers ring. 'Sequentially' means that forwarding numbers are ringing one at a time, in order of priority. 'Simultaneously' means that forwarding numbers are ring all at the same time

rules.description: Information on a call forwarding rule

id.description: Internal identifier of a forwarding/call flip phone number

uri.description: Canonical URI of a forwarding/call flip phone number

features.description: Type of option this phone number is used for. Multiple values are accepted

flipNumber.description: Number assigned to the call flip phone number, corresponds to the shortcut dial number

id.description: Internal identifier of a country

callingCode.description: Country calling code defined by ITU-T recommendations E.123 and E.164, see Calling Codes

emergencyCalling.description: Emergency calling feature availability/emergency address requirement indicator

isoCode.description: Country code according to the ISO standard, see ISO 3166

numberSelling.description: Determines whether phone numbers are available for a country

loginAllowed.description: Specifies whether login with the phone numbers of this country is enabled or not

callPickup.description: Specifies if picking up of other extensions' calls is allowed for the extension. If 'Presence' feature is disabled for the given extension, the flag is not returned

callMonitoring.description: Specifies if monitoring of other extensions' calls is allowed for the extension. If 'CallMonitoring' feature is disabled for the given extension, the flag is not returned

id.description: Internal identifier of an extension
Internal identifier of a greeting language

localeCode.description: Localization code of a greeting language

name.description: Official name of a greeting language

id.description: Internal identifier of a group

contactsCount.description: Amount of contacts in a group

id.description: Internal identifier of a language

greeting.description: Indicates whether a language is available as greeting language

formattingLocale.description: Indicates whether a language is available as formatting locale

ui.description: Indicates whether a language is available as UI language

action.description: Action description of the call operation

startTime.description: The call start datetime in ISO 8601 format including timezone, for example 2016-03-10T18:07:52.534Z

result.description: Status description of the call operation

recording.description: Call recording data. Returned if the call is recorded

id.description: Internal identifier of an extension

city.description: Official name of the city, belonging to the certain state

npa.description: Area code of the location (3-digit usually), according to the NANP number format, that can be summarized as NPA-NXX-xxxx and covers Canada, the United States, parts of the Caribbean Sea, and some Atlantic and Pacific islands. See for details North American Numbering Plan

nxx.description: Central office code of the location, according to the NANP number format, that can be summarized as NPA-NXX-xxxx and covers Canada, the United States, parts of the Caribbean Sea, and some Atlantic and Pacific islands. See for details North American Numbering Plan

state.description: ID and URI of the state this location belongs to, see State Info

phoneNumber.description: Phone number in E.164 format without a '+'

formattedNumber.description: Phone number formatted according to current brand's default country

vanityPattern.description: Vanity pattern for this number. Returned only when vanity search option is requested. Vanity pattern corresponds to request parameters nxx plus line or numberPattern

rank.description: The value is returned if the extendedSearch parameter is true. '10' is the closest match

uri.description: Canonical URI of a meeting resource

id.description: Internal identifier of a meeting as retrieved from Zoom

password.description: Password required to join a meeting

allowJoinBeforeHost.description: If 'True' then the meeting can be joined and started by any participant (not host only). Supported for the meetings of 'Scheduled' and 'Recurring' type.

startHostVideo.description: Enables starting video when host joins the meeting

startParticipantsVideo.description: Enables starting video when participants join the meeting

audioOptions.description: Meeting audio options. Possible values are 'Phone', 'ComputerAudio'

startTime.description: Start time of a meeting in ISO 8601 format including timezone, for example 2016-03-10T18:07:52.534Z

durationInMinutes.description: Duration of a meeting in minutes

id.description: Identifier of a timezone
Internal identifier of a message attachment

uri.description: Canonical URI of a message attachment

contentType.description: MIME type for a given attachment, for instance 'audio/wav'

vmDuration.description: Voicemail only Duration of the voicemail in seconds

id.description: Internal identifier of a message

availability.description: Message availability status. Message in 'Deleted' state is still preserved with all its attachments and can be restored. 'Purged' means that all attachments are already deleted and the message itself is about to be physically deleted shortly

conversationId.description: SMS and Pager only. Identifier of the conversation the message belongs to

creationTime.description: Message creation datetime in ISO 8601 format including timezone, for example 2016-03-10T18:07:52.534Z

deliveryErrorCode.description: SMS only. Delivery error code returned by gateway

direction.description: Message direction. Note that for some message types not all directions are allowed. For example voicemail messages can be only inbound

faxPageCount.description: Fax only. Page count in fax message

faxResolution.description: Fax only. Resolution of fax message. ('High' for black and white image scanned at 200 dpi, 'Low' for black and white image scanned at 100 dpi)

lastModifiedTime.description: The datetime when the message was modified on server in ISO 8601 format including timezone, for example 2016-03-10T18:07:52.534Z

messageStatus.description: Message status. Different message types may have different allowed status values.

pgToDepartment.description: Pager only True if at least one of the message recipients is Department extension

smsDeliveryTime.description: SMS only. The datetime when outbound SMS was delivered to recipient's handset in ISO 8601 format including timezone, for example 2016-03-10T18:07:52.534Z. It is filled only if the carrier sends a delivery receipt to RingCentral

smsSendingAttemptsCount.description: SMS only. Number of attempts made to send an outbound SMS to the gateway (if gateway is temporary unavailable)

subject.description: Message subject. For SMS and Pager messages it replicates message text which is also returned as an attachment

vmTranscriptionStatus.description: Voicemail only. Status of voicemail to text transcription. If VoicemailToText feature is not activated for account, the 'NotAvailable' value is returned

extensionNumber.description: Extension short number (usually 3 or 4 digits). This property is filled when parties communicate by means of short internal numbers, for example when calling to other extension or sending/receiving Company Pager message

location.description: Contains party location (city, state) if one can be determined from phoneNumber. This property is filled only when phoneNumber is not empty and server can calculate location information from it (for example, this information is unavailable for US toll-free numbers)

messageStatus.description: Status of a message. Returned for outbound fax messages only

faxErrorCode.description: Fax only. Error code returned in case of fax sending failure. Returned if messageStatus value is 'SendingFailed'

name.description: Symbolic name associated with a party. If the phone does not belong to the known extension, only the location is returned, the name is not determined then

phoneNumber.description: Phone number of a party. Usually it is a plain number including country and area code like 18661234567. But sometimes it could be returned from database with some formatting applied, for example (866)123-4567. This property is filled in all cases where parties communicate by means of global phone numbers, for example when calling to direct numbers or sending/receiving SMS

id.description: Device model identifier. Mandatory when ordering a HardPhone if boxBillingId is not used for ordering

page.description: The current page number. 1-indexed, so the first page is 1 by default. May be omitted if result is empty (because non-existent page was specified or perPage=0 was requested)

perPage.description: Current page size, describes how many items are in each page. Default value is 100. Maximum value is 1000. If perPage value in the request is greater than 1000, the maximum value (1000) is applied

pageStart.description: The zero-based number of the first element on the current page. Omitted if the page is omitted or result is empty

pageEnd.description: The zero-based index of the last element on the current page. Omitted if the page is omitted or result is empty

totalPages.description: The total number of pages in a dataset. May be omitted for some resources due to performance reasons

totalElements.description: The total number of elements in a dataset. May be omitted for some resource due to performance reasons

id.description: Internal identifier of a country

callingCode.description: Country calling code defined by ITU-T recommendations E.123 and E.164, see Calling Codes

emergencyCalling.description: Emergency calling feature availability/emergency address requirement indicator

isoCode.description: Country code according to the ISO standard, see ISO 3166

areaCode.description: Area code of the location (3-digit usually), according to the NANP number format, that can be summarized as NPA-NXX-xxxx and covers Canada, the United States, parts of the Caribbean Sea, and some Atlantic and Pacific islands. See North American Numbering Plan for details

country.description: Information on a country the phone number belongs to

dialable.description: Dialing format of a phone number

e164.description: E.164 (11-digits) format of a phone number

formattedInternational.description: International format of a phone number

formattedNational.description: Domestic format of a phone number

originalString.description: One of the numbers to be parsed, passed as a string in response

special.description: "True" if the number is in a special format (for example N11 code)

normalized.description: E.164 (11-digits) format of a phone number without the plus sign ('+')

enabled.description: Specifies if a permission is enabled or not

id.description: Standard resource properties ID

availability.description: This property has a special meaning only on Address Book Sync (e.g. a contact can be 'Deleted'). For simple contact list reading it has always the default value - 'Alive'

firstName.description: First name of a personal contact

lastName.description: Last name of a personal contact

middleName.description: Middle name of a personal contact

nickName.description: Nick name of a personal contact

company.description: Company name of a personal contact

jobTitle.description: Job title of a personal contact

homePhone.description: Home phone of a personal contact

homePhone2.description: The 2-d home phone of a personal contact

businessPhone.description: Business phone of a personal contact

businessPhone2.description: The 2-d business phone of a personal contact

mobilePhone.description: Mobile phone of a personal contact

businessFax.description: Business fax of a personal contact

companyPhone.description: Company phone of a personal contact

assistantPhone.description: Assistant phone of a personal contact

carPhone.description: Car phone of a personal contact

otherPhone.description: Other phone of a personal contact

otherFax.description: Other fax of a personal contact

callbackPhone.description: Callback phone of a personal contact

email2.description: The 2-d email of a personal contact

email3.description: The 3-d email of a personal contact

homeAddress.description: Home address of a personal contact

businessAddress.description: Business address of a personal contact

otherAddress.description: Other address of a personal contact

birthday.description: Date of birth of a personal contact in ISO 8601 format including timezone, for example 2016-03-10T18:07:52.534Z

webPage.description: Web page of a personal contact

id.description: Internal identifier of a phone number

country.description: Brief information on a phone number country

location.description: Location (City, State). Filled for local US numbers

paymentType.description: Payment type. 'External' is returned for forwarded numbers which are not terminated in the RingCentral phone system

status.description: Status of a phone number. If the value is 'Normal', the phone number is ready to be used. Otherwise it is an external number not yet ported to RingCentral

usageType.description: Usage type of the phone number

id.description: Internal identifier of a phone number

country.description: Brief information on a phone number country

extension.description: Information on the extension, to which the phone number is assigned. Returned only for the request of Account phone number list

features.description: Indicates if this phone number is enabled to appear as CallerId and/or to send outbound SMS from it. Returned only for the request of Extension phone number list

location.description: Location (City, State). Filled for local US numbers

paymentType.description: Payment type. 'External' is returned for forwarded numbers which are not terminated in the RingCentral phone system

status.description: Status of a phone number. If the value is 'Normal', the phone number is ready to be used. Otherwise it is an external number not yet ported to RingCentral

usageType.description: Usage type of the phone number

id.description: Internal identifier of an extension

partnerId.description: For Partner Applications Internal identifier of an extension created by partner. The RingCentral supports the mapping of accounts and stores the corresponding account ID/extension ID for each partner ID of a client application. In request URIs partner IDs are accepted instead of regular RingCentral native IDs as path parameters using pid = XXX clause. Though in response URIs contain the corresponding account IDs and extension IDs. In all request and response bodies these values are reflected via partnerId attributes of account and extension

uri.description: Canonical URI of a presence info resource

allowSeeMyPresence.description: If 'True' enables other extensions to see the extension presence status

dndStatus.description: Extended DnD (Do not Disturb) status. Cannot be set for Department/Announcement/Voicemail (Take Messages Only)/Fax User/Shared Lines Group/Paging Only Group/IVR Menu/Application Extension/Park Location extensions. The 'DoNotAcceptDepartmentCalls' and 'TakeDepartmentCallsOnly' values are applicable only for extensions - members of a Department; if these values are set for department outsiders, the 400 Bad Request error code is returned. The 'TakeDepartmentCallsOnly' status can be set through the old RingCentral user interface and is available for some migrated accounts only.

extension.description: Information on extension, for which this presence data is returned

message.description: Custom status message (as previously published by user)

pickUpCallsOnHold.description: If 'True' enables the extension user to pick up a monitored line on hold

presenceStatus.description: Aggregated presence status, calculated from a number of sources

ringOnMonitoredCall.description: If 'True' enables to ring extension phone, if any user monitored by this extension is ringing

userStatus.description: User-defined presence status (as previously published by the user)

id.description: Internal identifier of an extension

uri.description: Link to a profile image. If an image is not uploaded for an extension, only uri is returned

lastModified.description: The datetime when an image was last updated in ISO 8601 format, for example 2016-03-10T18:07:52.534Z

scales.description: List of URIs to profile images in different dimensions

from.description: Date and time in format YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm

to.description: Date and time in format YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm

uri.description: Link to a recipient extension resource

id.description: Internal identifier of a recipient extension
Internal identifier of the call recording

uri.description: Link to the call recording metadata resource

contentUri.description: Link to the call recording binary content

greetingLanguage.description: Information on language used for telephony greetings

formattingLocale.description: Formatting language preferences for numbers, dates and currencies

phoneNumber.description: Phone number in E.164 format without a '+'

reservedTill.description: The datetime up to which the number is reserved in ISO 8601 format including timezone, for example 2016-03-10T18:07:52.534Z. If it is omitted or explicitly set to 'null', the number will be un-reserved if it was reserved previously by the same session. 'Min' value is 30 seconds; 'Max' value is 30 days (for reservation by brand) and 20 minutes (for reservation by account/session)

phoneNumber.description: Phone number in E.164 format without a '+'

formattedNumber.description: Domestic format of a phone number

reservedTill.description: The datetime up to which the number is reserved in ISO 8601 format including timezone, for example 2016-03-10T18:07:52.534Z. No value means that number is not reserved anymore

reservationId.description: Internal identifier of phone number reservation; encoded data including reservation type (by brand, by account, by session), particular brand/account/session data, and reservation date and time

error.description: The error code in case of reservation/un-reservation failure

id.description: Dialing plan country identifier

forwardingNumberId.description: Internal identifier of a forwarding number; returned in response in the id field. Can be specified instead of the phoneNumber attribute

id.description: Internal identifier of a RingOut call

ringCount.description: Number of rings for a forwarding number (or group)

uri.description: Link to a forwarding number resource

id.description: Internal identifier of a forwarding number

phoneNumber.description: Phone number to which the call is forwarded

ref.description: The user's schedule specified for business hours or after hours; it can also be set/retrieved calling the corresponding method

uri.description: Canonical URI of the API version

apiVersions.description: Full API version information: uri, number, release date

featureName.description: Feature name, see all available values in Service Feature List

enabled.description: Feature status, shows feature availability for the extension

uri.description: Canonical URI of a service info resource

targetServicePlan.description: Information on account target service plan

id.description: Internal identifier of a service plan

street.description: Street address, line 1 - street address, P.O. box, company name, c/o

street2.description: Street address, line 2 - apartment, suite, unit, building, floor, etc.

status.description: Shipping status of the order item. It is set to 'Initial' when the order is submitted. Then it is changed to 'Accepted' when a distributor starts processing the order. Finally it is changed to Shipped which means that distributor has shipped the device.

carrier.description: Shipping carrier name. Appears only if the device status is "Shipped"

trackingNumber.description: Carrier-specific tracking number. Appears only if the device status is "Shipped"

address.description: Shipping address for the order. If it coincides with the Emergency Service Address, then can be omitted. By default the same value as the emergencyServiceAddress. Multiple addresses can be specified; in case an order contains several devices, they can be delivered to different addresses

id.description: Method identifier. The default value is "1" (Ground)

name.description: Method name, corresponding to the identifier

id.description: Internal identifier of a state

country.description: Information on a country the state belongs to

isoCode.description: Short code for a state (2-letter usually)

id.description: Internal identifier of a state

comment.description: A free-form user comment, describing the status change reason

transportType.description: Notifications transportation provider name. 'APNS' (Apple Push Notifications Service)

encryption.description: Optional parameter. Specifies if the message will be encrypted or not. If request contains any presence event filter the value by default is 'True' (even if specified as 'false'). If request contains only message event filters the value by default is 'False'

id.description: Internal identifier of a subscription

eventFilters.description: Collection of URIs to API resources (message-store/presence/detailed presence)

expirationTime.description: Subscription expiration datetime in ISO 8601 format including timezone, for example 2016-03-10T18:07:52.534Z

expiresIn.description: Subscription lifetime in seconds. The default value is 900

creationTime.description: Subscription creation datetime in ISO 8601 format including timezone, for example 2016-03-10T18:07:52.534Z

syncTime.description: Last synchronization datetime in ISO 8601 format including timezone, for example 2016-03-10T18:07:52.534Z

id.description: Internal identifier of a target service plan

name.description: Name of a target service plan

id.description: Internal identifier of a timezone

phoneNumber.description: Phone number to which the call is forwarded

scopes.description: List of active scopes for permission

id.description: Internal identifier of a permission

uri.description: Canonical URI of a permission resource

versionString.description: Version of the RingCentral REST API

uriString.description: URI part determining the current version

enabled.description: If 'True' then voicemails are allowed to be received

monday.description: Time intervals for a particular day

tuesday.description: Time intervals for a particular day

wednesday.description: Time intervals for a particular day

thursday.description: Time intervals for a particular day

friday.description: Time intervals for a particular day

saturday.description: Time intervals for a particular day

sunday.description: Time intervals for a particular day

code.description: The authorization code returned for your application

expires_in.description: The remaining lifetime of the authorization code

state.description: This parameter will be included in response if it was specified in the client authorization request. The value will be copied from the one received from the client

client_id.description: Required. Enter your application key (Production or Sandbox) here

redirect_uri.description: Required. This is a callback URI which determines where the response will be sent to. The value of this parameter must exactly match one of the URIs you have provided for your app upon registration. This URI can be HTTP/HTTPS address for web applications or custom scheme URI for mobile or desktop applications.

state.description: Optional, recommended. An opaque value used by the client to maintain state between the request and callback. The authorization server includes this value when redirecting the user-agent back to the client. The parameter should be used for preventing cross-site request forgery

token.description: Active access or refresh token to be revoked

access_token.description: Access token to pass to subsequent API requests

expires_in.description: Issued access token TTL (time to live), in seconds

refresh_token.description: Refresh token to get a new access token, when the issued one expires

refresh_token_expires_in.description: Issued refresh token TTL (time to live), in seconds

scope.description: List of permissions allowed with this access token, white-space separated

token_type.description: Type of token. Use this parameter in Authorization header of requests

endpoint_id.description: Unique identifier of a client application passed by the client, or auto-generated by server if not specified in request

grant_type.description: Must hold password value for Resource Owner Credentials flow. If client application is not authorized by the specified grant_type, response does not contain refresh_token and refresh_token_ttl attributes

access_token_ttl.description: Optional. Access token lifetime in seconds; the possible values are from 600 sec (10 min) to 3600 sec (1 hour). The default value is 3600 sec. If the value specified exceeds the default one, the default value is set. If the value specified is less than 600 seconds, the minimum value (600 sec) is set

refresh_token_ttl.description: Optional. Refresh token lifetime in seconds. The default value depends on the client application, but as usual it equals to 7 days. If the value specified exceeds the default one, the default value is applied. If client specifies refresh_token_ttl<=0, refresh token is not returned even if the corresponding grant type is supported

username.description: Phone number linked to account or extension in account in E.164 format with or without leading "+" sign

extension.description: Optional. Extension short number. If company number is specified as a username, and extension is not specified, the server will attempt to authenticate client as main company administrator

scope.description: Optional. List of API permissions to be used with access token (see Application Permissions). Can be omitted when requesting all permissions defined during the application registration phase

endpoint_id.description: Optional. Unique identifier of a client application. You can pass it in request according to pattern [a-zA-Z0-9_\-]{1,64}. Otherwise it is auto-generated by server. The value will be returned in response in both cases

parameters.description: The direction for the result records. It is allowed to specify more than one direction. If not specified, both inbound and outbound records are returned. Multiple values are accepted
parameters.name: direction

parameters.description: Call type of a record. It is allowed to specify more than one type. If not specified, all call types are returned. Multiple values are accepted
parameters.name: type

parameters.description: Indicates the page number to retrieve. Only positive number values are allowed. Default value is '1'.
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Indicates the page size (number of items). If not specified, the value is '100' by default.
parameters.name: perPage

uri.description: Canonical URI of the business address resource
Canonical URI of the business address resource

parameters.description: Extension number of a user. If specified, returns call log for a particular extension only. Cannot be specified together with the phoneNumber filter
parameters.name: extensionNumber

parameters.description: Phone number of a caller/call recipient. If specified, returns all calls (both incoming and outcoming) with the mentioned phone number. Cannot be specified together with the extensionNumber filter
parameters.name: phoneNumber

parameters.description: The direction for the result records. It is allowed to specify more than one direction. If not specified, both inbound and outbound records are returned. Multiple values are accepted
parameters.name: direction

parameters.description: Call type of a record. It is allowed to specify more than one type. If not specified, all call types are returned. Multiple values are accepted
parameters.name: type

parameters.description: The default value is 'Simple' for both account and extension call log
parameters.name: view

parameters.description: 'True' if only recorded calls have to be returned
parameters.name: withRecording

parameters.name: dateFrom

parameters.name: dateTo

parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Indicates the page size (number of items). If not specified, the value is '100' by default.
parameters.name: perPage

nextPageUri.description: URL of the next page, if any

parameters.description: Type of synchronization. The default value is 'FSync'
parameters.name: syncType

parameters.description: Value of syncToken property of the last sync request response
parameters.name: syncToken

parameters.description: Number of records per page to be returned. The max number of records is 250, which is also the default. For FSync — if the number of records exceeds the parameter value (either specified or default), all of the pages can be retrieved in several requests. For ISync — if the number of records exceeds the page size, the number of incoming changes to this number is limited
parameters.name: perPage

parameters.description: Internal identifier of a page. It can be obtained from the 'nextPageId' parameter passed in response body
parameters.name: pageId

records.description: List of personal contacts from the extension address book

parameters.description: Phone number in E.164 (11-digits) format with or without plus '+'. Multiple values are supported
parameters.name: phoneNumber

parameters.description: If specified, only contacts whose First name or Last name start with the mentioned substring are returned. Case-insensitive
parameters.name: startsWith

parameters.description: Sorts results by the specified property. The default is 'First Name'

parameters.description: Indicates the page number to retrieve. Only positive number values are allowed. Default value is '1'
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Indicates the page size (number of items). If not specified, the value is '100' by default
parameters.name: perPage

get.description: Get Extension Call Log Record by ID

from.description: Sender of a pager message. The extensionNumber property must be filled

replyOn.description: Internal identifier of a message this message replies to

text.description: Text of a pager message. Max length is 1024 symbols (2-byte UTF-16 encoded). If a character is encoded in 4 bytes in UTF-16 it is treated as 2 characters, thus restricting the maximum message length to 512 symbols

to.description: Optional if replyOn parameter is specified. Receiver of a pager message. The extensionNumber property must be filled

parameters.description: Internal identifier of a country. If not specified, the response is returned for the brand country
parameters.name: countryId

phoneNumbers.description: Multiple dial-in phone numbers to connect to audio conference service, relevant for user's brand. Each number is given with the country and location information, in order to let the user choose the less expensive way to connect to a conference. The first number in the list is the primary conference number, that is default and domestic

allowJoinBeforeHost.description: Determines if host user allows conference participants to join before the host

to.description: Recipient information. Phone number property is mandatory. Optional for resend fax request

sendTime.description: The datetime to send fax at, in ISO 8601 format including timezone, for example 2016-03-10T18:07:52.534Z. If time is not specified, the fax will be send immediately

coverIndex.description: Optional. Cover page index. If not specified, the default cover page which is configured in "Outbound Fax Settings" is attached. See also 'Available Cover Pages' table below

coverPageText.description: Optional. Cover page text, entered by the fax sender and printed on the cover page. Maximum length is limited to 1024 symbols

originalMessageId.description: Internal identifier of the original fax message which needs to be resent. Mandatory for resend fax request

parameters.description: Indicates the page number to retrieve. Only positive number values are allowed. Default value is '1'
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Indicates the page size (number of items). If not specified, the value is '100' by default
parameters.name: perPage

records.description: List of extension grants with the data

parameters.description: Indicates the page number to retrieve. Only positive number values are allowed. Default value is '1'
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Indicates the page size (number of items). If not specified, the value is '100' by default
parameters.name: perPage

meetingType.description: Type of a meeting. 'Instant' - meeting that is instantly started as soon as the host creates it; 'Scheduled' - common scheduled meeting; 'Recurring' - a recurring meeting. If the specified meeting type is 'Scheduled' then schedule property is mandatory for request

password.description: Password required to join a meeting. Max number of characters is 10

allowJoinBeforeHost.description: If 'True' then the meeting can be joined and started by any participant (not host only). Supported for the meetings of 'Scheduled' and 'Recurring' type.

startHostVideo.description: Enables starting video when host joins the meeting

startParticipantsVideo.description: Enables starting video when participants join the meeting

audioOptions.description: Meeting audio options. Possible values are 'Phone', 'ComputerAudio'

uri.description: Canonical URI of a meeting service info resource

supportUri.description: URI to retrieve support information for meetings functionality

intlDialInNumbersUri.description: URI to retrieve international dial in numbers

meetingType.description: Type of a meeting. 'Instant' - meeting that is instantly started as soon as the host creates it; 'Scheduled' - common scheduled meeting; 'Recurring' - a recurring meeting. If the specified meeting type is 'Scheduled' then schedule property is mandatory for request

password.description: Password required to join a meeting. Max number of characters is 10

allowJoinBeforeHost.description: If 'True' then the meeting can be joined and started by any participant (not host only). Supported for the meetings of 'Scheduled' and 'Recurring' type.

startHostVideo.description: Enables starting video when host joins the meeting

startParticipantsVideo.description: Enables starting video when participants join the meeting

audioOptions.description: Meeting audio options. Possible values are 'Phone', 'ComputerAudio'

records.description: List of records with message information

parameters.description: Specifies the availability status for the resulting messages. Default value is 'Alive'. Multiple values are accepted
parameters.name: availability

parameters.description: Specifies the conversation identifier for the resulting messages
parameters.name: conversationId

parameters.description: The start datetime for resulting messages in ISO 8601 format including timezone, for example 2016-03-10T18:07:52.534Z. The default value is dateTo minus 24 hours
parameters.name: dateFrom

parameters.description: The end datetime for resulting messages in ISO 8601 format including timezone, for example 2016-03-10T18:07:52.534Z. The default value is current time
parameters.name: dateTo

parameters.description: The direction for the resulting messages. If not specified, both inbound and outbound messages are returned. Multiple values are accepted
parameters.name: direction

parameters.description: If 'True', then the latest messages per every conversation ID are returned
parameters.name: distinctConversations

parameters.description: The type of the resulting messages. If not specified, all messages without message type filtering are returned. Multiple values are accepted
parameters.name: messageType

parameters.description: The read status for the resulting messages. Multiple values are accepted
parameters.name: readStatus

parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Indicates the page size (number of items). If not specified, the value is '100' by default
parameters.name: perPage

parameters.description: The phone number. If specified, messages are returned for this particular phone number only
parameters.name: phoneNumber

parameters.description: If the value is 'True', then the message is purged immediately with all the attachments. The default value is 'False'
parameters.name: purge

parameters.description: Internal identifier of a message thread
parameters.name: conversationId

readStatus.description: Read status of a message to be changed. Multiple values are accepted

parameters.name: dateTo

parameters.description: Direction for the resulting messages. If not specified, both inbound and outbound messages are returned. Multiple values are accepted
parameters.name: direction

parameters.description: If 'True', then the latest messages per every conversation ID are returned
parameters.name: distinctConversations

parameters.description: Type for the resulting messages. If not specified, all types of messages are returned. Multiple values are accepted

from.description: Phone number of the caller. This number corresponds to the 1st leg of the RingOut call. This number can be one of user's configured forwarding numbers or arbitrary number

to.description: Phone number of the called party. This number corresponds to the 2nd leg of the RingOut call

callerId.description: The number which will be displayed to the called party

playPrompt.description: The audio prompt that the calling party hears when the call is connected

country.description: Optional. Dialing plan country data. If not specified, then extension home country is applied by default

from.description: Sender of an SMS message. The phoneNumber property must be filled to correspond to one of the account phone numbers which is allowed to send SMS

to.description: Receiver of an SMS message. The phoneNumber property must be filled

text.description: Text of a message. Max length is 1000 symbols (2-byte UTF-16 encoded). If a character is encoded in 4 bytes in UTF-16 it is treated as 2 characters, thus restricting the maximum message length to 500 symbols

id.description: Identifier of a device

contentUri.description: Link to the call recording binary content

contentType.description: Call recording file format. Supported format is audio/x-wav

serviceFeatures.description: Service features information, see Service Feature List

limits.description: Limits which are effective for the account

value.description: Description of custom data. Mandatory for create, if there is no attachment specified. Maximum length is limited to 256 symbols

homeCountry.description: Information on a user home country

originalString.description: One of the numbers to be parsed, passed as a string in response

areaCode.description: Area code of the location (3-digit usually), according to the NANP number format, that can be summarized as NPA-NXX-xxxx and covers Canada, the United States, parts of the Caribbean Sea, and some Atlantic and Pacific islands. See North American Numbering Plan for details

formattedNational.description: Domestic format of a phone number

formattedInternational.description: International format of a phone number

dialable.description: Dialing format of a phone number

e164.description: E.164 (11-digits) format of a phone number

special.description: "True" if the number is in a special format (for example N11 code)

normalized.description: E.164 (11-digits) format of a phone number without the plus sign ('+')

country.description: Information on a country the phone number belongs to

parameters.description: Internal identifier of a home country. The default value is ISO code (ISO 3166) of the user's home country or brand country, if the user is undefined
parameters.name: homeCountry

parameters.description: The default value is "False". If "True", the numbers that are closer to the home country are given higher priority
parameters.name: nationalAsPriority

originalStrings.description: Phone numbers passed in a string. The maximum value of phone numbers is limited to 64. The maximum number of symbols in each phone number in a string is 64

uri.description: Canonical URI of the phone numbers resource

records.description: List of phone numbers filtered by the specified criteria

parameters.description: Area code of the location
parameters.name: areaCode

parameters.description: Two-letter country code, complying with the ISO standard
parameters.name: countryCode

parameters.description: Internal identifier of a country; '1'- the US; '39' - Canada; '224' - the UK. The default value is '1'
parameters.name: countryId

parameters.description: A string of digits (one and more) that should not appear among the last four digits (line part) of the phone numbers that will be returned. It is possible to specify several exclude parameters. If specified, it is taken into account in all returned phone numbers both in the phone numbers satisfying to parameters of lookup and in alternative phone numbers (in case when extendedSearch is specified)
parameters.name: exclude

parameters.description: If the value is 'False', then the returned numbers exactly correspond to the specified NXX, NPA and LINE or countryCode, areaCode and numberPattern parameters. If the value is 'True', then the resulting numbers are ranked and returned with the rank attribute values (1-10). The default value is 'False'
parameters.name: extendedSearch

parameters.description: LINE pattern for vanity or wildcard search. Digits, Latin characters and asterisks are allowed (usually 4 characters)
parameters.name: line

parameters.description: Phone number pattern (for wildcard or vanity search). For NANP countries (US, Canada) is concatenation of nxx (the first three digits) and line. If the first three characters are specified as not digits (e.g. 5** or CAT) then parameter extendedSearch will be ignored.
parameters.name: numberPattern

parameters.description: NXX pattern for vanity or wildcard search. Digits, Latin characters and asterisks are allowed (usually 3 characters)
parameters.name: nxx

parameters.description: Area code (mandatory). For example, 800, 844, 855, 866, 877, 888 for North America; and 647 for Canada
parameters.name: npa

parameters.description: Payment type. Default is 'Local' (it should correlate with the npa provided)
parameters.name: paymentType

parameters.description: Indicates the page size (number of items). If not specified, the value is '10' by default
parameters.name: perPage

parameters.description: Specifies if SMS activation is available for the number. If specified, it is taken into account in all returned phone numbers both in the phone numbers satisfying to parameters of lookup and in alternative phone numbers (in case when extendedSearch is specified). If not specified, the value is null.
parameters.name: smsEnabled

parameters.description: If 'True' then aggregated presence status is returned in a notification payload in the 'presenceStatus' field
parameters.name: aggregated

eventFilters.description: Mandatory. Collection of URIs to API resources (see Event Types for details). For APNS transport type only message event filter is available

parameters.description: If 'True' then aggregated presence status is returned in a notification payload
parameters.name: aggregated

eventFilters.description: Collection of URIs to API resources (see Event Types). Mandatory field
